name: StaticWebApps
help:
The Static Web Apps CLI, also known as SWA CLI, serves as a local development tool for Azure Static Web Apps. It can:
  • Serve static app assets, or proxy to your app dev server
  • Serve API requests, or proxy to APIs running in Azure Functions Core Tools
  • Emulate authentication and authorization
  • Emulate Static Web Apps configuration, including routing

properties.name: AppLocation
properties.help: Location for the static app source code (default: <c>./</c>)

properties.name: AppArtifactLocation
properties.help: Location of the build output directory relative to the <c>--app-location</c>. (default: <c>./</c>)

properties.name: ApiLocation
properties.help: API folder or Azure Functions emulator address

properties.name: ConfigLocation
properties.help: Directory where the staticwebapp.config.json file is found (default: ./)

properties.name: Ssl
properties.help: Serve the app and API over HTTPS (default: <c>false</c>)

properties.name: SslCertificate
properties.help: SSL certificate (.crt) to use for serving HTTPS

properties.name: SslKey
properties.help: SSL key (.key) to use for serving HTTPS

properties.name: DevServerTimeout
properties.help: Time to wait(in ms) for the dev server to start (default: <c>30000</c>)

properties.name: AppLocation
properties.help: Directory containing the source code of the front-end application (default: <c>./</c>).

properties.name: ApiLocation
properties.help: Directory containing the source code of the API application.

properties.name: OutputLocation
properties.help: Directory containing the built source of the front-end application. The path is relative to <c>--app-location</c> (default: <c>./</c>).

properties.name: ConfigLocation
properties.help: Directory where the staticwebapp.config.json file is found (default: ./)

properties.name: DeploymentToken
properties.help: Secret token used to authenticate with the Static Web Apps

properties.name: Environment
properties.help: Type of deployment environment where to deploy the project (default: <c>preview</c>).
